pros: Family Run Operation - Generally Laid Back - Product offering
cons: Family Run Operation - Generally (Too) laid back (unless you're a Good Ole Boy to THE good ole boy) - Too many products (of the same line)

review_title: Poor ethics, poorly managed and does not care about their employees
pros: Wonderful opportunity to work with students and help shape young minds.
cons: Difficult atmosphere to work in when there is no support from upper managment. Fellow staff are great but there is an obvious disconnect between upper administration and the relationship that the president and vice president have with the rest of the school. Upper administration makes me knee jerk decisions and will sacrifice the quality of education that students receive by using recent graduates that are unqualifed to teach as instructors. This "christian" school does not practice the ethics that it proposes to teach others. They lie to staff and to students and students parents. I would not work here, nor would I send my child here.

job_title: Adjunct Assistant Professor in Knoxville, TN
pros: The people I have met and interacted with are great people, very helpful, and care for the students .
cons: The building where I worked the most is very, very outdated and needs lots of work. The classrooms, laboratories, and bathrooms were horrible.

review_title: It's not surprising that it closed.
pros: Tight-knit community, lots of cooperation between all departments.
cons: Terrible management, very irresponsible with money, disorganized.

pros: The ability to teach as many courses as one can handle...
cons: Too many committees and work groups assigned will full teaching load
